intro: Anacardium corymbosum, commonly known as the Brazilian nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon basin. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The tree produces an aggregate fruit known as a "corymb," which contains the edible seeds used for the Brazil nut. The plant is notable for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments and its role in supporting local biodiversity.
